required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AZD2423 Safety and Tolerability Study in Patients With Moderate and Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease(COPD)
clinical_study.official_title: A 4-week, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Randomised, Parallel Group, Multi-Centre, Phase IIa Study to Investigate the Tolerability and Safety of 100 mg Oral AZD2423 in Patients With Moderate to Severe COPD

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to investigate the tolerability and safety of AZD2423 in Patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Changes in Laboratory Variables Other Than Monocytes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, 1 week, 2 weeks, 3 weeks, 4 weeks and 5 weeks (follow-up)
primary_outcome.description: Number of all participants with clinically significant changes in laboratory variables, except monocyte, assessed at all the listed time points

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, 1 week, 2 weeks, 3 weeks, 4 weeks and 5 weeks (follow-up)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in vital signs assessed at all the listed time points

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Changes in ECG Variables
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, 1 week, 2 weeks, 3 weeks, 4 weeks and 5 weeks (follow-up)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in ECG variables assessed at all the listed time points

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Changes in Physical Examination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, 1 week, 2 weeks, 3 weeks, 4 weeks and 5 weeks (follow-up)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with clinically significant changes in physical examination assessed at all the listed time points
Monocyte count in peripheral blood at baseline (Pre-dose, Day 1)
Monocyte count in peripheral blood at end of treatment (4 weeks)
Monocyte count in peripheral blood at follow-up (Week 5; 1 week after end of treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Morning FEV1 at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of 10 days of pre-treatment measurements (day -10 to -1)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements conducted by patient in morning upon rising, before intake of morning dose of investigational product but after clearing out mucus. Patients was to refrain from taking rescue medication prior to measurement if possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: Morning FEV1 During Last 7 Days of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of the last 7 days of treatment (week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements conducted by patient in morning upon rising, before intake of morning dose of investigational product but after clearing out mucus. Patients was to refrain from taking rescue medication prior to measurement if possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evening FEV1 at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of 10 days of pre-treatment measurements (day -10 to -1)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement conducted by patient in evening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evening FEV1 During Last 7 Days of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of the last 7 days of treatment (week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement conducted by patient in evening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Morning Peak Expiratory Flow (PEF) at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of 10 days of pre-treatment measurements (day -10 to -1)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements conducted by patient in morning upon rising, before intake of morning dose of investigational product but after clearing out mucus. Patients was to refrain from taking rescue medication prior to measurement if possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: Morning PEF During Last 7 Days of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of the last 7 days of treatment (week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurements conducted by patient in morning upon rising, before intake of morning dose of investigational product but after clearing out mucus. Patients was to refrain from taking rescue medication prior to measurement if possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evening PEF at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of 10 days of pre-treatment measurements (day -10 to -1)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement conducted by patient in evening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evening PEF During Last 7 Days of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of the last 7 days of treatment (week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement conducted by patient in evening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Exacerbations of Chronic Pulmonary Disease Tool (EXACT) Total Score at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of 7 days of pre-treatment measurements (day -7 to -1)
secondary_outcome.description: The EXACT Tool is a Patient Reported Outcome (PRO) measure; 14 items evaluated on 5- or 6-point scales; total score ranges from 0 to 100 (higher values indicate more severe exacerbation). Baseline is the mean value over the 7 days prior to randomisation.

secondary_outcome.measure: EXACT Total Score During Last 7 Days of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of the last 7 days of treatment (week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: The EXACT Tool is a Patient Reported Outcome (PRO) measure; 14 items evaluated on 5- or 6-point scales; total score ranges from 0 to 100 (higher values indicate more severe exacerbation).

secondary_outcome.measure: Breathlessness, Cough and Sputum Scale (BCSS) (Evening) Total Score at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of 10 days of pre-treatment measurements (day -10 to -1)
secondary_outcome.description: The BCSS scale includes one question for each of the symptoms of breathlessness, cough, and sputum. The total BCSS score ranges from 0 to 12; higher scores indicate greater symptom severity. The minimally important difference has been defined as a change in total score of greater than 0.3 units. Baseline is mean of 10 days prior to treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: BCSS (Evening) Total Score During Last 7 Days of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of the last 7 days of treatment (week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: The BCSS scale includes one question for each of the symptoms of breathlessness, cough, and sputum. The total BCSS score ranges from 0 to 12; higher scores indicate greater symptom severity. The minimally important difference has been defined as a change in total score of greater than 0.3 units.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rescue Medication Use During the Last 7 Days of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Average of the last 7 days of treatment (week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of inhalations of short acting Î²2 agonist (SABA) or short acting muscarinic antagonist (SAMA) per day.

secondary_outcome.measure: St George's Respiratory Questionnaire for COPD (SGRQ) Total Score at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: The SGRQ-C includes 40 questions in 3 domains: Symptoms (distress due to respiratory symptoms, 7 questions), Activity (disturbance of physical activity, 13 questions), Impacts (overall impact on daily life and well-being, 20 questions). Scores are expressed as a percentage. Baseline is Day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: SGRQ Total Score at End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Decrease in score represents improved Quality of Life; increase represents deteriorated Quality of Life. An increase or decrease of 4 or more percent units is judged as the Minimal Clinically Important Difference.

secondary_outcome.measure: CCL2 (Chemokine Ligand for CCR2b Receptor) Concentration in Plasma at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline = Day 1 = Visit 2

secondary_outcome.measure: CCL2 Concentration in Plasma at End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: week 4
secondary_outcome.description: End of treatment = 4 weeks = Visit 6

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Amyloid-A (SAA) Concentration in Plasma at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline = Day 1 = Visit 2

secondary_outcome.measure: SAA Concentration in Plasma at End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: week 4
secondary_outcome.description: End of treatment = 4 weeks = Visit 6

secondary_outcome.measure: Areaa Under the Curve From 0 to 24 Hours (AUC 0-24), Population Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of AZD2423 at Steady State
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 blood samples (pre- and post dose) per visit collected at weeks 1, 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: PK-model: 1-compartment population model with first order absorption. AUC was estimated at steady state

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax, Population Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of AZD2423 at Steady State
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 blood samples (pre- and post dose) per visit collected at weeks 1, 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: PK-model: 1-compartment population model with first order absorption. Cmaxwas estimated at steady state

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Concentration (Tmax) Population Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of AZD2423 at Steady State
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 blood samples (pre- and post dose) per visit collected at weeks 1, 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: PK-model: 1-compartment population model with first order absorption. tmax was estimated at steady state

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss/F) Population Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of AZD2423 at Steady State
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 blood samples (pre- and post dose) per visit collected at weeks 1, 2 and 4
secondary_outcome.description: PK-model: 1-compartment population model with first order absorption. (Vss/F) was estimated at steady state

intervention.description: 100 mg oral treatment once daily for 28 days
Oral treatment once daily for 28 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female of non-child bearing potential. Only women of non-child bearing potential are included in the study i.e. women who are permanently or surgically sterilised or post menopausal.
- Between 40 and 80 years of age at Visit 1
- Clinical diagnosis of COPD (GOLD stage 2 or 3)
- FEV1/FVC <70% and FEV1 between 30 and 80% of the predicted normal post-bronchodilator (GOLD stage 2 or 3)
- Current or ex-smokers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any clinically significant disease or disorder (including history of abnormal immune function) which, in the opinion of the Investigator, may either put the subject at risk or influence the way the drug works
- Any lung disease other than COPD, recent respiratory infections which have not resolved fully, active tuberculosis or at risk of reactivation of tuberculosis.
- Any abnormal findings in physical examination, blood or urine test results, vital signs or ECG at Visit 1 that may put the subject at risk during the study, affect their ability to take part or influence the results of the study
- Immunisation with a live vaccine within 3 months or other vaccination within 30 days before planned start of treatment
- Worsening of COPD symptoms within 4 weeks prior to start of study needing hospitalisation, oral steroids or antibiotics.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 11 centres in 2 countries: 5 in Bulgaria and 6 in Slovakia. The first patient was enrolled on 09 October 2010 and the last patient last visit was on 08 March 2011.

outcome.time_frame: 2 blood samples (pre- and post dose) per visit collected at weeks 1, 2 and 4

group.title: AZD2423 100 mg
group.description: Two 50 mg AZD2423 tablets, once daily for 28 days

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo to match AZD2423 50 mg tablets, once daily for 28 days

measure.title: Cmax, Population Pharmacokinetic Evaluation of AZD2423 at Steady State
measure.description: PK-model: 1-compartment population model with first order absorption. Cmaxwas estimated at steady state

outcome.description: PK-model: 1-compartment population model with first order absorption. tmax was estimated at steady state
outcome.time_frame: 2 blood samples (pre- and post dose) per visit collected at weeks 1, 2 and 4

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Institutions or Investigators were permitted to publish or present the study results from their site (or the overall results), providing the article or presentation was submitted to and approved by AstraZeneca beforehand.
